required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NAVISTAR® THERMOCOOL® SF Catheter: Observational Study
clinical_study.official_title: NAVISTAR® THERMOCOOL® SF Catheter: Observational Study in a Younger and Older Drug Refractory, Recurrent, Symptomatic Paroxysmal AF Population

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, interventional, observational, unblinded, single-arm, multicenter registry of younger and older subjects with drug refractory, recurrent, symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is to measure the "real-world" acute procedural outcomes (procedural efficiency, acute safety, and effectiveness at one year) associated with use of the NAVISTAR® THERMOCOOL® SF Catheter in a clinical setting in subjects with drug refractory, recurrent symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation.

primary_outcome.description: The fluoroscopy time will be measured for each phase (access, mapping, ablation, and validation) of the procedure and summed to derive the total time.
Confirmation of entrance and/or exit block across all targeted pulmonary veins.

secondary_outcome.description: RF applications is defined as the number of times RF energy is delivered during the procedure.
Total RF time is defined as the total time that RF energy is delivered during the procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fluid Volume Delivered Via Ablation Catheter
Number of Patients With Repeat Ablations

secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms attributed to paroxysmal atrial fibrillation reported at 12 month visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Lost Work Days, Related to AF, at 12 Month Visit
Number of Patients With Inpatient Hospital Visit(s) Related to Atrial Fibrillation
Number of Patients With Outpatient Emergency Visits Related to Atrial Fibrillation
Change in Atrial Fibrillation Effect on Quality of Life (AFEQT) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change is calculated as 12 month overall AFEQT score minus score at screening. An overall AFEQT score ranges from 0 to 100. A score of 0 corresponds to complete disability (or responding "extremely" limited, difficult or bothersome to all questions answered), while a score of 100 corresponds to no disability (or responding "not at all" limited, difficult or bothersome to all questions answered). Therefore a positive change in score corresponds to improvement in AF symptoms.

arm_group.description: These patients have drug refractory, recurrent, symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, are aged 18 years or older, and have provided written informed consent to participate in the study, including consent to undergo catheter ablation with the study device.

intervention.description: Administer anesthesia according to standard EP lab protocol, assess the fluid status of the subject (after each liter of infusate), determine if diuresis is necessary, and treat accordingly.

study_pop.textblock: Older and younger patients with drug refractory, symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Drug refractory, recurrent, symptomatic paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
- Age 18 years or older
- Patients must be able and willing to provide written informed consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Atrial fibrillation secondary to electrolyte imbalance, thyroid disease, or reversible or non-cardiac cause
- Previous ablation for atrial fibrillation
- Episodes of atrial fibrillation that last longer than 30 days and are terminated via cardioversion
- Uncontrolled heart failure, or NYHA Class III or IV heart failure
- Documented intra-atrial thrombus or other abnormality on pre-ablation echocardiogram
- Contraindication to anticoagulation
- Stroke, cardiac surgery, unstable angina, myocardial infarction or percutaneous coronary intervention within the past 3 months
- Awaiting cardiac transplantation
- Heart disease in which corrective surgery is anticipated within 6 months
- Enrollment in investigational drug, biologic or device study
- Subjects unwilling to comply with protocol or follow-up requirements
- Patients who are pregnant

outcome.title: Change in Atrial Fibrillation Effect on Quality of Life (AFEQT) Total Score
outcome.description: Change is calculated as 12 month overall AFEQT score minus score at screening. An overall AFEQT score ranges from 0 to 100. A score of 0 corresponds to complete disability (or responding “extremely” limited, difficult or bothersome to all questions answered), while a score of 100 corresponds to no disability (or responding “not at all” limited, difficult or bothersome to all questions answered). Therefore a positive change in score corresponds to improvement in AF symptoms.
outcome.population: Subset of Safety Population with non-missing AFEQT data at 12 months.

Therefore a positive change in score corresponds to improvement in AF symptoms.
measure.population: Subset of Safety Population with non-missing AFEQT data at 12 months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is an agreement between the Principal Investigator (PI)/Institution and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss, present, or publish trial results after the trial is completed. Please contact Biosense Webster for additional information.
